author: Bruce Jacobs

review: I recieved this  Fire TV Stick in the mail yesterday.  I opened the package, read the extremely short directions, plugged my Fire Stick into the wall, plugged it into the TV, connected it to my wireless LAN, started a subscription to Netflix, downloaded the Netflix App and watched my first HD movie on my HD television.Pros.  Other than one problem, everything worked like a charm.  The setup was simple, and the visual quality of the movies are outstanding, its too early to tell but so far it seems to work flawlessly.  My initial opinion is I love it.Cons.  There were no instructions for setting up the stick for Netflix, which requires the down load of the NetFlix APP. As a matter of fact there was no mention of any APP at all.  I think this is poor since a new user wouldn't have a clue that an APP of any sort was necessary.  I'm a first time user so I had no idea how to set up Netflix.  I got on the NetFlix home page and read the instructions for setting up with an Amazon Fire Stick.  This is where I first discovered there was such a thing as an App that needed to be downloaded.  I followed the instructions but as you might guess the instructions were dated did not match the screens provided by the Stick, so I could not download the Netflix app.  I had to resort to the old tried and true technique of  fat fingering and trial and error using the screens provided by the Stick.  Much by accident I finally navigated from point A to point B so to speak, downloaded the APP and now everything operates very smoothly.
